summary: This is a sealed affirmation and application by an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York, filed on February 5, 2019, seeking a court order to unseal discovery materials from a settled civil defamation lawsuit (Giuffre v. Maxwell) for use in a then-secret federal grand jury investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and others for sex trafficking of minors. The application was granted by Judge Robert W. Sweet.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney whose office is making the application to unseal civil discovery materials for a grand jury investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Defendant in Civil Case / Subject of Criminal Investigation
persons.context: The defendant in the underlying civil defamation lawsuit (Giuffre v. Maxwell) and a subject of the referenced federal grand jury investigation for sex trafficking.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the ongoing federal grand jury investigation for possible violations of sex trafficking laws.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: An attorney at Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP who represented the plaintiff in the civil case against Ghislaine Maxwell; her litigation files are believed to contain information relevant to the criminal investigation.

persons.name: Robert W. Sweet
persons.context: The judge who issued the original protective order in the civil case and the subsequent order granting the government's application to access the sealed materials.

connections.description: Described together as perpetrators of sex crimes in the underlying civil lawsuit and as subjects of the same federal grand jury investigation.
McCawley was an attorney for the plaintiff suing Maxwell for defamation in the civil case from which the discovery materials originate.
The affirming AUSA works in the office of U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.

events.title: Civil Defamation Lawsuit Filed
events.description: Plaintiff (Virginia Giuffre) files a civil action against Ghislaine Maxwell alleging Maxwell made defamatory statements denying Giuffre was a victim of sex crimes by Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: Judge Robert W. Sweet issues a protective order in the civil case (Giuffre v. Maxwell), restricting disclosure of materials marked 'CONFIDENTIAL'.

events.title: Civil Case Settled
events.description: The parties enter into a settlement agreement and voluntarily dismiss the civil defamation lawsuit.

events.title: Government Seeks to Unseal Civil Discovery
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office files a sealed application to obtain discovery materials from the settled civil case for use in a secret grand jury investigation into Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: Court Orders Release of Materials
events.description: Judge Robert W. Sweet grants the government's application, ordering Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP to provide the sealed civil discovery materials to the government for the grand jury investigation.

keyFacts: As of February 2019, the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY was conducting a secret grand jury investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and others for sex trafficking of minors (Sections 1591, 1594(c), 2422(b) of Title 18).
The government sought discovery materials from the settled civil case Giuffre v. Maxwell (15 Civ. 7433), believing they contained information relevant to the criminal investigation.
A protective order from the civil case was blocking the law firm Boies Schiller & Flexner from complying with a grand jury subpoena.
The application and order were filed under seal to prevent alerting potential criminal targets, indicating the investigation was not publicly known at that time.
Judge Robert W. Sweet granted the government's request, allowing the sealed civil discovery to be used in the criminal probe.
